moves.1. e4: This is one of the most beautiful games I've ever played, and the opponent was so great and smart, displaying the amazing attacking will of the white and the powerful game reading by the black
Now, the White's intentions of the attack is quite clear
moves.7... d6 8. Bxh6: 8. Bxh6!, good move, winning a pawn and beginning his plan of weakening the Black's king side
moves.8... Nd7: If  8. ... gxh6, 9. Qxh3 and the black is in trouble after the white coordinate his forces with the knight at f3 and the white bishop
moves.9. h4: 9. h4!, applying more pressure, giving himself attacking options
moves.9... c5: 9. ... c5, trying to distract the white by making trouble in the center
moves.10. Bxg7: 10. Bxg7!, distraction didn't work and the white is giving his opponent a surprise
moves.10... Kxg7 11. h5 Rh8: 11. ... Rh8!, the only option, if 11. ... gxh5, 12. Qg5
moves.12. O-O-O: 12. O-O-O!, neutralizing the threat on the rock at h1
moves.12... Ng8 13. hxg6 Rxh1 14. Rxh1 fxg6 15: 15. Nd-f6 !, good move, preventing the white from Rh7
moves.16. f4: Planning to remove the knight from the f6 square to make the move Rh7
moves.19. Rh7+ Kf8 20. Nxd5: Now, nothing stops the white from using the f file for attack
moves.20... Ne7 21. Nxe7 Qxe7 22. Qf4+: 22. Qf4  !, wining move and the black couldn't resist the powerful attack so he leaves the game
